nodes.text: Palob Godalhi was a Human male who was the son of decorated constable Janu Godalhi and played a major role in the Tethan resistance against the Galactic Empire.

Palob Godalhi was the chief aide to Winfrid Dagore during the Galactic Civil War. He came into possession of the Moldy Crow when Dagore was captured by IG-72 and Dace Bonearm; though he later landed it in the Rebel ship New Hope, giving it to the Alliance for their missions. From there, the ship was requisitioned by Kyle Katarn.
After the fall of Palpatine, Palob together with his father wrote several history books about the Galactic Civil War.

During the time of the Galactic Federation of Free Alliances, Palob Godalhi served in the capacity of Master Historian, the successor to Arhul Hextrophon. When the book The Last Days of Arhul Hextrophon were published, Godalhi cautioned against dismissing the more eccentric writings, believing that there might be a glimmer of truth in the text that was otherwise deemed apocryphal.
Palob Godalhi's name is an anagram of Pablo Hidalgo.
